msContents.summary: Letter of Eutychides to Zenon: he collected and sent to Zenon 163 fish from four boats

msItem.note: Written along the fibers with 18 lines; on the back, across the fibers, is the address
Written in broad strokes by the same hand as P.Cair.Zen. II 59186, a letter by Onnophris. Either Onnophris or Eutychides wrote both letters

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 75 in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Many names of fishermen, -- Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI sec. IX

div.ab:
Eutychides to Zenon greeting. I have sent to you, from the boat of Petos -- coracini, 1 choerus, 1 latus, (1 alabes). From the boat of Eranouphi, 40 coracini, 1 choerus. From the boat of Ph1lon, 70 coracini, 2 choeri, 4 lati, one of which was large. From the boat of Pasis -- coracini, 1 choerus.
Total. Coracini 153 Choeri 5 Lati 5, of which one was large. Good-bye. The 18th.
[Verso:] To Zenon.
